content.statement: aku-038-differential-diagnosis is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Mesenteric-Ischemia that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding aku-038-differential-diagnosis helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of aku-038-differential-diagnosis include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of aku-038-differential-diagnosis.

definitions_glossary.concept: A fundamental idea or notion in the domain
definitions_glossary.property: A characteristic or attribute of an entity
definitions_glossary.relationship: A connection or association between concepts

conditions.name: Small Bowel Obstruction
conditions.key_pitfall: Strangulated SBO IS mesenteric ischemia - look for closed loop, mesenteric haziness

conditions.name: Acute Pancreatitis
conditions.key_pitfall: Severe pancreatitis can cause splanchnic hypoperfusion leading to secondary NOMI

conditions.name: Perforated Peptic Ulcer
conditions.key_pitfall: Perforated viscus can coexist with or result from mesenteric ischemia

conditions.name: Acute Cholecystitis/Cholangitis
conditions.key_pitfall: Severe biliary sepsis can cause NOMI; check SMA on CT

conditions.name: Ruptured Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm
distinguishing_features: CT shows AAA with retroperitoneal hematoma
conditions.key_pitfall: AAA repair can cause mesenteric ischemia (IMA coverage, embolization)

conditions.name: Aortic Dissection with Mesenteric Malperfusion
distinguishing_features: May have limb or renal malperfusion
conditions.key_pitfall: This IS mesenteric ischemia but requires different treatment paradigm (aortic repair first vs. mesenteric fenestration)

conditions.name: Acute Diverticulitis
distinguishing_features: CT shows colonic diverticula with fat stranding
conditions.key_pitfall: Complicated diverticulitis (abscess, perforation) can overlap significantly

conditions.name: Inflammatory Bowel Disease Flare
conditions.key_pitfall: IBD patients can develop mesenteric thrombosis (hypercoagulable)

conditions.name: Appendicitis
conditions.key_pitfall: Rarely confused in typical presentations; elderly appendicitis may be atypical

conditions.name: Inferior Myocardial Infarction
conditions.key_pitfall: MI can cause NOMI through cardiogenic shock; can coexist

conditions.name: Diabetic Ketoacidosis
conditions.key_pitfall: Mesenteric ischemia can precipitate DKA; don't assume pain is just from DKA

high_risk_features: Severe pain out of proportion to exam
step_1_clinical_suspicion.action: If any high-risk feature + unexplained abdominal pain → immediate CTA

essential_labs: Lactate (elevated supports ischemia but normal does not exclude)
step_2_rapid_assessment.essential_imaging: CTA abdomen/pelvis with arterial and venous phases

step_3_interpretation.alternative_diagnosis_features: Look for findings of other conditions while reviewing for ischemia

when_to_think_ischemia: Pain out of proportion to physical exam
Rapid clinical deterioration without clear cause

common_errors.error: Attributing pain to constipation without further workup

common_errors.consequence: Normal plain films do not exclude early ischemia

common_errors.error: Waiting for lactate to rise before imaging
common_errors.consequence: Lactate is a late marker; don't wait

common_errors.error: Accepting 'gastroenteritis' in elderly with risk factors
common_errors.consequence: Mesenteric ischemia is a great mimicker

common_errors.error: Not looking at mesenteric vessels on CT for non-vascular diagnosis
common_errors.consequence: Incidental mesenteric disease may be causative

related.relationship: Mesenteric ischemia is part of acute abdomen differential

sources.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Enumerate the key differential diagnoses for mesenteric ischemia
Identify distinguishing features of each mimic
Apply a systematic approach to excluding alternatives
Recognize pitfalls in the diagnostic workup
clinical_pearls: If you're thinking about mesenteric ischemia, you should be ordering CTA
Atrial fibrillation + abdominal pain = mesenteric ischemia until proven otherwise
Normal lactate does not exclude early ischemia
The diagnosis you don't consider is the one you'll miss
